content:
IHE ITI committee has three supplements out for public comment. https://mailchi.mp/ihe/ihe-iti-tf-supplements-published-for-pc-and-ti-2019-05-24?e=2d68229859
Two are FHIR relevant
One is an update to ATNA to add support for FHIR AuditEvent as a way to record audit events, and as a query to support reporting, alerting, and such https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dGIgCLU91Go
The other is a new implementation guide on a FHIR based Patient Identity Management for health information exchanges. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VDT9Ujlyp44
Please review and provide comments. You do not need to be a member to review and provide comments.

IHE IT Infrastructure is seeking comment on a white paper that proposes a content profile for cataloging system configuration properties.

Configuration management of system-to-system interfaces that enable IHE profiles is burdensome within the healthcare enterprise. Survey of Network Interfaces Form, (SNIF) https://ihe.github.io/SNIF/SNIF-Whitepaper.html provides a consistent method to catalogue configuration properties for human and machine consumption during installation, upgrade and repair.

This 3 minute video describes SNIF https://youtu.be/EbA3tdycTqs.

We would appreciate any comments in GitHub https://github.com/IHE/SNIF/issues and particularly looking for assistance in answering open questions and issues https://github.com/IHE/SNIF/blob/master/Issues.md

Steve

IHE released for Public Comment an update to IUA (our OAuth profile), the HIE-Whitepaper (including FHIR profiles), and published the whole ITI Technical Framework in html form. All found at the new site: https://profiles.ihe.net/
Discussion on the #ihe zulip stream
